comments:
Workbench client throws exception that it cannot find ContextContainer when handling ContextContainerEvent.

The exception is:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: ContextContainer does not exist for event: org.eclipse.corona.container.project/CoronaDemo
	at org.eclipse.corona.container.event.ContextContainerEvent.<init>(ContextContainerEvent.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.corona.container.event.ContextContainerEventFactory.createContainerEvent(ContextContainerEventFactory.java:74)
	at org.eclipse.corona.collaboration.topic.TopicManager.handleEvent(TopicManager.java:198)
	at org.eclipse.corona.container.event.ContextContainerEventAdmin.handleEvent(ContextContainerEventAdmin.java:168)

ProjectContainerManagerProxy was refactored.  The method openProjectContainerForMember() was changed to no longer add the ConextContainer to the cache.  

Consequently, the ContextContainerEventAdmin service cannot find the ContextContainer associated with the event.
Re-added logic add PCC to cache if it was opened successfully.

traces.message: ContextContainer does not exist for event: org.eclipse.corona.container.project/CoronaDemo
